Package fr.cnrs.iees.rvgrid.statemachine

Interface StateMachine

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    StateMachineEngine
    public interface StateMachine
    A finite state-machine. A StateMachine is defined by a list of States, with Transitions between them triggered by Events. Actions occurring during a transition or when in a particular state are implemented using Procedures.
    Author:
    Jacques Gignoux - 14 ao√ªt 2019

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static java.lang.String INITIAL_PSEUDO_STATE
      The initial pseudo-state (i.e. before the start of the state machine)

    • Field Detail

      • INITIAL_PSEUDO_STATE

        static final java.lang.String INITIAL_PSEUDO_STATE
        The initial pseudo-state (i.e. before the start of the state machine)
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getStates

        java.util.Collection<State> getStates()

        Read-only access to the states of this machine.

        NB: Implementations must use Collections.unmodifiableCollection(...) to prevent accidental modification of the state list after machine initialisation.

        Returns:
        the immutable list of states

      • getInitialPseudoStates

        java.util.Collection<Transition> getInitialPseudoStates()

        Read-only access to the initial pseudo-states of this machine. Notice that a pseudo-state is actually a transition where the initial state is unspecified.

        NB: Implementations must use Collections.unmodifiableCollection(...) to prevent accidental modification of the initial pseudo-states list after machine initialisation.

        Returns:
        the immutable list of initial pseudo-states

      • getTransitions

        java.util.Collection<Transition> getTransitions()

        Read-only access to the transitions of this machine.

        NB: Implementations must use Collections.unmodifiableCollection(...) to prevent accidental modification of the transition list after machine initialisation.

        Returns:
        the immutable list of transitions

      • setCurrentState

        void setCurrentState​(State state)
        Sets the current state of the state machine to its argument.
        Parameters:
        state - the new current state

      • getCurrentState

        State getCurrentState()
        Returns:
        the current state of the machine

      • getEvents

        java.util.Collection<Event> getEvents()

        Read-only access to the events of this machine.

        NB: Implementations must use Collections.unmodifiableCollection(...) to prevent accidental modification of the event list after machine initialisation.

        Returns:
        the immutable list of events

      • inInitialState

        boolean inInitialState()
        Checks if the state machine has started.
        Returns:
        true if the state machine is in its initial pseudo-state.
